item.title: Nintendo Switch Online Adds New Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Icons
item.description:
Summary

  • Nintendo Switch Online offers new Pokemon Scarlet and Violet icons for subscribers, including Penny and Sylveon.
  • Subscribers can claim the seventh and final set of icons for The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero DLC with Platinum Points.
  • The final wave also includes five new Backgrounds and five new Frames to obtain.

Nintendo Switch Online has added a new set of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet icons for subscribers, which will be the seventh and final set geared towards The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero DLC. The first wave of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet icons catering to the DLC arrived in mid-November 2024, succeeding last year’s Indigo Disk icons that ran for six sets. Each wave runs for a limited time, and the final set will be available between December 31, 2024 and January 7, 2025.

Nintendo Switch Online is a subscription service for Switch users, offering online multiplayer, cloud saving, and voice chat. October 2021 saw an expanded Nintendo Switch + Expansion Pack tier added, which grants users access to Nintendo 64, Sega Genesis, and Game Boy Advance games in the catalog. Nintendo Switch Online subscribers were recently treated to new NES and Game Boy titles, including two classic games, Tetris and Tetris DX , and subscribers can also take advantage of the DLCs available for Animal Crossing: New Horizons , Mario Kart 8 , and Splatoon 2 .

Spotted by Serebii.net on Twitter, it was confirmed that the seventh and final set of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet icons are now available for Nintendo Switch Online subscribers. Fans have eight new icons to use, including Penny, the Mythical Pokemon Pecharunt, Pikachu, Eevee, Shiny Rayquaza, a Team Star member, and Charcadet. There are also five new Backgrounds and five new Frames to claim, sporting a variety of colors and patterns, including a red and purple colorway exclusive to the game. Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players can use a powerful Sylveon build to conquer Tera Raid battles in-game, therefore, the Eevee evolution is bound to be a popular icon among subscribers.

Nintendo Switch Online Adds New Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Icons

Claiming new Pokemon icons is a straightforward procedure, and each new icon in the seventh set costs 10 Platinum Points with Backgrounds and Frames costing 5 Platinum Points each. Pokemon fans on Twitter were excited to receive the new icons, but some wished more Eeveelutions had been released. The Sylveon icon was by far the most popular and subscribers are keeping their fingers crossed for Glaceon and new Perrin icons in the future.

Mario-themed icons are also available to Nintendo Switch Online subscribers, alongside a good selection for The Legend of Zelda fans. The subscription’s Missions and Rewards system encourages subscribers to complete missions to obtain Platinum Points rewards, including retro icons and icon elements, and the rewards catalog rotates regularly to keep the prizes fresh.

item.title: Control: How To Get Ability Points
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Ability Points In Control
  • Skill Trees & Skill Costs In Control

The story of Control sees its main character, Jesse Faden, exploring the Oldest House to unlock the mysteries of the Federal Bureau of Control, also known as the FBC. Along the way, she will not only uncover where her brother has been taken, but also obtain various powers that she will use to destroy the Hiss that are invading the headquarters. Even more, each power that Jesse unlocks can be upgraded and made even more powerful through the use of Ability Points that can be invested in the game's skill trees.

There are a total of eight skills trees that players can upgrade to make Jesse more powerful throughout the game, each of them corresponding to a different power or part of Jesse's character. These categories are Health, Shield, Energy, Melee, Launch, Seize, Levitate, and Ground Slam. Progressing through these trees will also help unlock the game's various trophies and achievements. But players are going to want to know how to unlock Ability Points to invest in each of these categories to help them build out Jesse in the most efficient way possible.

How To Unlock Ability Points In Control

There are two ways for players to unlock Ability Points in the game, with the first being discovering the hidden locations around the map . The Oldest House holds a lot of secrets, and as players unlock more of their powers, they can then use these to access previously inaccessible areas in the vein of other Metroidvania-type games.

But the easiest and more surefire way to unlock Ability Points is to complete missions . Finishing both the main story missions and the numerous side quests will give players various amounts of Ability Points that they can invest in their Skills Trees.

Once the player has finished the game's opening missions, every story mission they complete will net them four Ability Points to use. With 10 total main missions, that's 40 Ability Points to be earned over the course of the story.

The side missions are where the bulk of Ability Points can be earned , as the base game alone has 18 side quests to dive into (19 for PlayStation users). But while the main story missions have a steady amount of 4 Ability Points as rewards, each side mission has varying amounts that can be unlocked.

Here is a breakdown of every side mission (including the game's DLC) and how many Ability Points they can unlock , from lowest to highest:

Side Missions That Reward Two Ability Points

  • A Matter of Time
  • Mold Removal
  • A Merry Chase
  • What a Mess: Burn the Trash

Side Missions That Reward Three Ability Points

  • A Captive Audience
  • Fridge Duty
  • Langston's Runaways
  • Mr. Tommasi
  • The Enemy Within
  • What a Mess: Clear the Clog
  • What A Mess: Clear the Mold
  • Found Footage (The Foundation DLC)
  • Jesse Faden Starring in "Swift Platform" (The Foundation DLC)
  • Pope's Collection (The Foundation DLC)

Side Missions That Reward Four Ability Points

  • Old Friends
  • Old Growth
  • Self-Reflection
  • A Good Defense
  • What A Mess: Even More Mold
  • What A Mess: Talk to the Plants
  • What A Mess: Take A Break

Skill Trees & Skill Costs In Control

Having all of these Ability Points is useful, but it's also important to know how many are needed to invest in each of the eight skill trees . Here is the breakdown for each one — and how many Ability Points are needed to unlock each level.

item.title: Fortnite Fans Want a UI Feature Back
item.description:
Many Fortnite fans have made their voice heard and proclaimed how much they want the "In-Game Shop & Locker UI" button to return to the menu that appears at the end of a match. Even though Fortnite left early access in 2020, it continues to receive patches and updates frequently to this very day. Given how active the community is, there is no reason for Epic Games to abandon the Battle Royale or any of the other game modes connected to Fortnite .

Summary

  • Fortnite fans want the "In-Game Shop & Locker" UI button back for convenience.
  • Epic Games frequently updates Fortnite, but features that players like sometimes get removed.
  • Removing the button may have been due to issues with the Cancel Purchase option.

While most updates bring new content to Fortnite , others remove features that have become outdated, given the developers trouble due to unfixable glitches and errors, or simply because it doesn't make sense it have it in-game anymore. A few years ago, Epic Games added a button to the end-of-match screen that allowed players to visit the Item Shop and their in-game Locker without having to return to the lobby. Most players were quite happy with this addition because, not only did it save them time, but it was also particularly useful for those playing with a team; this way, not everyone in the squad had to return to the lobby so one player could change their outfits or check out the shop.

Unfortunately, the "In-Game Shop & Locker" button wasn't available for long, as it was constantly getting removed and put back into the game. At some point, it simply never returned and fans accepted that it had been permanently vaulted. Recently, Reddit user TheCatMan612 brought up this topic of conversation in a thread, asking other players if they wanted Epic to bring back the button and most responses were positive, as it is a feature that only improves Fortnite as a game.

What Is the Item Shop & Locker Button in Fortnite?

It is likely that the "In-Game Shop & Locker" button was removed due to its incompatibility with the Cancel Purchase option. For example, if a player quickly visited the Item Shop while waiting for the next game and accidentally purchased and equipped a skin immediately, they would be unable to cancel this purchase without using a Refund Ticket, as it would've already been used in-game. This could lead to angry fans demanding more Refund Tickets, causing chaos due to a simple quality-of-life improvement to Fortnite .

To solve this matter, Epic Games could add a modified version of the "In-Game Shop & Locker" button, removing the Item Shop aspect of it and simply allowing gamers to visit the in-game locker at the end of the match to switch between owned cosmetic items. This way, they'd only have to leave a match to look at the Item Shop in Fortnite , which is arguably less urgent and could be done once they decided to return to the lobby.

item.title: Dead By Daylight: 21 Fun Survivor Builds
item.description:
Summary

  • Dead by Daylight offers endless gameplay possibilities with a wide array of Survivor perks for fun and unique trials.
  • Players can create interesting perk combinations tailored to their playstyle, refreshing even seasoned Survivors' experiences.
  • Experimenting with different Survivor builds can provide challenging gameplay, strategic advantages, and entertaining moments in The Fog.

Dead by Daylight offers the potential for infinitely diverse gameplay thanks to a catalog of over 100 Survivor perks. The interplay between the vast number of perks in Dead by Daylight provides the potential for fun and unique trials for both solo players and Survivors with friends.

Outside the meta Survivor gameplay, players can experiment with different builds that may not guarantee escape but will promise a good time. Whether it's endlessly evading hooks, confusing Killers, or staying stealthy, there are interesting perk combinations Dead by Daylight players can tailor around a specific play style, refreshing even seasoned Survivors' time in The Fog.

Updated on December 31st, 2024 by Mara Cowley: Dead by Daylight continues to be the most popular asymmetrical multiplayer horror game, and with its popularity there come more characters, more perks, and more potential builds. Those who have already sweated away hundreds or even thousands of hours might want to do something a little different from just plugging in what perks are currently considered to be the best in the meta. As such, this article has been updated to provide examples of builds which could shake up gameplay for survivors as much as DbD will keep the game a fresh and exciting experience.

1 The Medic Build

Take on the Role of the Healer to Keep Allies in the Fight

Healers are always the underappreciated but most valued of all roles in multi-player games, the only thing standing between more gung-ho players and certain death. In Dead by Daylight , a successful team-out may rely on a hard-working healer, and knowing just how integral the player was to success is one of the most rewarding feelings in the world.

Better Than New (Rebecca Chambers): Increase a player's action speeds after healing them .

For the People (Zarina Kassir): Gain the broken status and lose a health state to help an ally get back on their feet.

We'll Make It (General Perk): The player heals others with an additional 100% to their healing speed for up to 90 seconds.

Botany Knowledge (Claudette Morel): Increase base healing speed by up to 50%.

2 The Totem Build

Treasure-Hunt Across Maps for the Totems

Cleansing totems is a good way to rack up bloodpoints, and can offer a reprieve from all the bloody death and hunting from the trial, while also benefitting the team as it eradicates any hexes the Killer has brought into the trial. There are several perks which are all about tracking and cleansing totems, which can sometimes be hard to pinpoint on certain maps.

Small Game (General Perk): Hear an audio cue looking in the direction of Totems in a 45 ° cone.

Inner Strength (Nancy Wheeler): After cleansing a totem, enter a locker to heal a health state.

Overzealous (Haddie Kaur): After cleansing a totem, gain a bonus to repair speed. Hexed totems provide a higher bonus.

Counterforce (Jill Valentine): Cleanse totems faster, and see the aura of the furthest totem on the map.

3 The Stun Build

Fight Back with these Handy Stun Perks

Survivors are very limited in ways they can defend themselves against Killers, leaving running the major means method of self-preservation. But certain perks allow a modicum of self-defense, allowing them to stun the Killers which buys precious seconds. Perks themselves unlock the stun action, but Survivors can use pallets for this as well.

Any Means Necessary (Yui Kimura): Reset a previously dropped pallet to the upright position.

Head on (Jane Romero): Fast-exiting a locker stuns nearby Killers for 3 seconds.

Blast Mine (Jill Valentine): After completing a minimum of 40% repair progress on a generator, trap it with a mine which stuns and blinds Killers who attempt to damage it.

Windows of Opportunity (Kate Denson): Unlocks the auras of breakable walls, window vaults and pallets.

4 The Quick & Stealthy Vault Build

Make Quick Escapes to Survive Chases

With the help of these perks, players can vault quickly, gain a burst of speed, and even hoodwink the Killers as they leave no evidence of their vault behind.

  • Finesse (Lara Croft): If the player is healthy, they vault with +20% to their Vaulting speed.
  • Quick and Quiet (Meg Thomas): Loud noise notifications from rushing windows, pallets, or lockers are all suppressed.
  • Dance with Me (Kate Denson): After rushing a vault or locker, scratch marks are suppressed for 3 seconds.
  • Lithe (Feng Min): Grants 50% Haste for 3 seconds after vaulting a window or pallet.

5 The Hero Build

Save Other Survivors From Perishing on Hook

Teamwork is the best hope for Survivors to make their escape, so it is always a good idea to unhook fellow Survivors. This build revolves around this act of altruism, giving benefits to reduce the chances of the Survivor being tunneled.

  • We'll Make It (General Perk): The player heals others with an additional 100% to their healing speed for up to 90 seconds.
  • Borrowed Time (Bill Overbeck): Extends Endurance of the Survivor unhooked for up to 10 seconds, and grants them haste for 10 seconds.
  • Babysitter (Steve Harrington): After unhooking another Survivor, the player sees the Killer's aura for 8 seconds. The Survivor who was unhooked doesn't leave blood pools or scratch marks and gains haste for up to 30 seconds.
  • Kindred (General Perk): Whenever the Killer is within 16 meters of a hooked Survivor, the Killer's aura is revealed to the player.

6 No Mither Build

Survivors Can Use This Build To Play DbD On Hard Mode

This build capitalizes on the game's notoriously worst and most absurd perk, No Mither. Escaping a trial with this setup is the ultimate challenge for players seeking to test their skills.

  • No Mither (David King): The player's pools of blood and grunts of pain are drastically reduced, their recovery speed is increased by 25%, and they can fully recover from the dying state. However, the Survivor is permanently injured and cannot heal, making them constantly one-hit.
  • Decisive Strike (Laurie Strode): Decisive Strikes activate for 60 seconds after being unhooked; if the Killer picks the player up in this time, they can escape their grasp by passing a skill check.
  • Object Of Obsession (Laurie Strode): Anytime the Killer reads their player's aura, the player also sees the Killer's. This perk makes the Survivor a huge target for a chase, as their aura is revealed to the Killer every 30 seconds for 3 seconds. The player's repairing, healing, and cleansing speeds increase by 6%.
  • Lithe (Feng Min): After performing a rushed vault action, the player receives a 50% Haste buff.

7 Gen Rush Build

Players Can Speedrun The Trial With This Build

There are many generator perks and, therefore, plenty of generator-dedicated builds, but this one stands out as the most fun. It works best when used as a co-op build, and players can also bring in a toolbox to finish the generators at record speed.

  • Invocation: Weaving Spiders (Sable Ward): This perk allows the player to perform an Invocation in the basement for 60 seconds, revealing their aura to all Survivors and speeding up the process if others join. Upon completion, all generators require ten fewer repair charges, but the player will become injured and suffer the Broken status effect for the rest of the trial.
  • Resilience (General Perk): This perk pairs well with Invocation because when the player is injured, their repairing, healing, and other action speeds increase by 9%.
  • Déjà Vu (General Perk): The auras of the three generators closest to each other are revealed to the player, and their repair speed on those generators is increased by 6%.
  • This Is Not Happening (General Perk): Increases the success zone of great skill checks by 30% when injured.

8 The Luck Build

Players Must Rely On RNG To Survive

This build adds hilarious unpredictability to trials, with perks that maximize randomness, resulting in either incredible luck or great misfortune. Players can also use Offerings to boost their chances of success.

  • Dramaturgy (Nicolas Cage): When Healthy, players can activate Dramaturgy to be granted a 0.5-second burst of +25% Haste followed by one of four randomized effects: become Exposed for 12 seconds, gain an extended 2-second Haste, scream, or acquire a random Rare Item with Add-ons.
  • Bardic Inspiration (Aestri Yazar): When standing still, the player can enter a unique animation where they play the lute for 15 seconds, empowering nearby Survivors for 90 seconds with an effect dependent on the outcome of a rolled dice. The effects range from the player screaming to boosting skill check progress by up to 3%.
  • Slippery Meat (General Perk): Increases the player's odds of successfully unhooking themselves by 4% (on top of the base 4%) and adds to their number of available hook escape attempts by +3.
  • Up The Ante (Ace Visconti): Boosts all players' odds of successfully self-unhooking by 3% for every Survivor still in the trial, stackable up to a maximum of 9%. This perk combines well with Slippery Meat, granting the player a 17% chance of unhooking themselves.

9 The Deception Build

Survivors Can Outsmart Killers With These Mind Game Perks

This build empowers Survivors to shift the balance against the Killer with skillfully employed mind games. Using these perks, players can trick and misdirect the Killer, creating openings for strategic and satisfying plays.

  • Mirrored Illusion (Aestri Yazar): After repairing a generator by 50%, Mirrored Illusion activates, allowing the player to produce a clone of themselves for 120 seconds on a generator, chest, exit gate, or totem.
  • Diversion (Adam Francis): Players can distract the Killer by throwing a pebble that creates a loud sound and fake scratch marks in that direction.
  • Red Herring (Zarina Kassir): After repairing a generator for 3 seconds, Survivors can misdirect the Killer by entering a locker and triggering a missed-skill check notification at the generator's location.
  • Deception (Élodie Rakoto): Players can confound Killers by fake entering lockers, after which they leave no scratch marks or pools of blood for 3 seconds.

10 The Trap Build

Survivors Can Turn The Tables On The Killer With These Trap Perks

This build enables Survivors to strategically entrap the Killer, turning pallets and generators into deadly weapons in their arsenal.

  • Wiretap (Ada Wong): After repairing generators by 50%, players can install a trap that will reveal the Killer's aura to all Survivors within 14 meters.
  • Chemical Trap (Ellen Ripley): After repairing generators by 50%, Chemical Trap can be installed on a dropped pallet. When the Killer breaks it, the Trap explodes and slows them.
  • Any Means Necessary (Yui Kimura): Allows the player to reset a dropped palette so Survivors can re-use it.
  • Blast Mine (Jill Valentine): After repairing a generator by 50%, the player can install a trap on a partially progressed generator. When the Killer damages it, the Mine explodes, stunning them.

11 The Anti-Slugging Build

Downed Survivors Can Escape Capture With This Build

While there is an unwritten rule in Dead by Daylight that "slugging" is considered bad manners since it creates boring gameplay for downed players, this build makes it advantageous for Survivors and allows for some hilarious close-call self-saves.

  • Unbreakable (Bill Overbeck): Players can recover from the dying state once per trial, and their recovery speed is increased by 35%.
  • Tenacity (David Tapp): Players can crawl while recovering and are 50% faster when doing so. Survivors' grunts of pain are also decreased by 75% for stealthy escapes.
  • Soul Guard (Cheryl Mason): After recovering, players gain the Endurance status effect (temporary invincibility) for 8 seconds. If Cursed by a Hex, they can recover infinitely during the trial.
  • Boon: Exponential (Jonah Vasquez): All Survivors can self-recover from the dying state while in the aura of the Boon Totem, which also speeds up recovery by 100%.

12 The Invisible Build

Survivors Can Vanish From Sight With This Stealth Build

If combined with careful movement and awareness, the following build can help Survivors slip through trials undetected or disappear mid-chase. Players can maximize their stealthiness by playing as one of the quietest Survivors.

  • Light-Footed (Ellen Ripley): When healthy, the player's running sounds are suppressed. It has a 20-second cooldown after the player performs a rushed vault action.
  • Lucky Break (Yui Kimura): When injured, the Survivor leaves no scratch marks or pools of blood for 60 seconds.
  • Distortion (Jeff Johansen): The Survivor's aura is concealed whenever the Killer attempts to read it, and their scratch marks are suppressed for 10 seconds.
  • Lightweight (General Perk): The player's scratch marks are more difficult for the Killer to track and fade faster.

13 The Self-Save Build

Solo Survivors Can Rescue Themselves With These Perks

Perfect for solo Survivors, or the lone wolf player, this following build employs one of the best Survivor perks, Decisive Strike, to empower players to be the masters of their fate.

  • Deliverance (Adam Francis): The player can successfully unhook themselves, provided they have previously safely unhooked someone else.
  • Plot Twist (Nicolas Cage): When Injured, the player can silently enter the Dying State. Plot Twist suppresses grunts and bleeding and allows for full recovery from the Dying State. After self-recovery, the player is instantly healed and gains a 50% haste effect.
  • Decisive Strike (Laurie Strode): If the Survivor is picked up within 60 seconds after being unhooked or unhooking themselves, they have the power to stun the Killer and break free from their hold by passing a skill check.
  • Power Struggle (Élodie Rakoto): Carried Survivors can drop a pallet to stun the Killer and escape their grasp.

14 The Locker Build

Players Can Use Lockers To Evade And Toy With The Killer

The following build transforms lockers into secret weapons for Survivors, capable of stunning Killers and shielding Survivors, making for an easy game of cat and mouse.

  • Head On (Jane Romero): Players can stun the Killer by quickly exiting a locker.
  • Quick & Quiet (Meg Thomas): This perk synergizes with Head On by allowing players to sprint silently into lockers.
  • Flashbang (Leon Scott Kennedy): While in a locker, Survivors can craft flash grenades, which can blind and distract the Killer.
  • Inner Strength (Nancy Wheeler): After cleansing a totem, Survivors can heal one health state by entering a locker.

15 The Speed Build

Survivors Can Outrun Danger With These Speedy Perks

Survivors can escape from even the deadliest of Killers with this build, which provides an incredible combined speed boost so players can outpace their violent attackers.

  • Boon: Dark Theory (Yoichi Asakawa): All Survivors within range of the Boon Totem gain a 2% speed boost.
  • Sprint Burst (Meg Thomas): Unless they are Exhausted, any time the player runs, they sprint 150% faster for 3 seconds.
  • Fixated (Nancy Wheeler): The player walks 20% faster and can see their scratch marks. The increased walking speed allows players to use Sprint Burst less, saving it for when necessary.
  • Hope (General Perk): When the exit gates are powered, the player gains a 7% speed increase.

16 The Selfless Medic Build

Survivors With Friends Can Put Their Team First With This Altruistic Build

The following build requires players to make bold rescues and risk their own lives for their fellow Survivors, the true build of a selfless and heroic player.

  • For the People (Zarina Kassir): A healthy player can instantly trade one health state with another Survivor.
  • Made For This (Gabriel Soma): This perk works in tandem with For the People by providing the player with a 10-second Endurance status effect upon healing a teammate.
  • We're Gonna Live Forever (David King): Increases the player's healing speed on a dying Survivor by 100%. Provided they have already saved a Survivor, the player also grants a 10-second Endurance status effect to Survivors they recover.
  • Buckle Up (Ashley J. Williams): This perk gives a 5-second 50% Haste benefit to any Survivors the player heals and suppresses their scratch marks. Both players also see the Killer's aura for 10 seconds.

17 The Sabotage Build

Survivors Can Disrupt The Killer's Plans With This Sabotage Build

Through daring rescues and strategic sabotage, these perks allow players to foil the Killer's attempts at hooking fellow Survivors. Survivors can bring useful items, such as flashlights or toolboxes, for additional sabotaging opportunities.

  • Empathy (Claudette Morel): The auras of injured and downed Survivors are revealed to the player within a certain range, setting up potential rescues.
  • Breakout (Yui Kimura): When the player is within 6 meters of a carried Survivor, they gain a 7% Haste effect, and the held Survivor's wiggle speed is increased by 20%.
  • Saboteur (Jake Park): Players can sabotage hooks without a Toolbox and can see the auras of all hooks within a certain range.
  • Champion of Light (Alan Wake): While shining a flashlight, Champion of Light provides the survivor with 50% Haste, and successfully blinding the Killer results in them suffering a 20% Hindered status effect for 6 seconds.

18 The Aura-Reading Build

These "Wall Hack" Perks Give Survivors Maximum Information On The Killer

This aura-reading build provides Survivors with unparalleled awareness during trials, taking the guesswork out of looping and ensuring they are always one step ahead of the Killer.

  • Dark Sense (General Perk): When a generator is completed, Dark Sense is activated, revealing the Killer's aura for 10 seconds if they come within 24 meters of the Survivor.
  • Object of Obsession (Laurie Strode): Each time the player's aura is revealed to the Killer, the Survivor also sees the Killer's aura. The player is 100% more likely to be the Obsession, and if they are, the Killer sees their aura for 3 seconds every 30 seconds.
  • Scene Partner (Nicolas Cage): When in the Killer's terror radius, Scene Partner makes the player scream, which reveals the Killer's aura for 5 seconds. There is a 50% chance of the player screaming again, extending the reveal by 2 seconds.
  • Alert (Feng Min): Whenever the Killer breaks a pallet or damages a generator, their aura is revealed to the player.

19 Extended Aura Reading Build

Read Auras Across Distances

Aura-reading is a useful tool in the arsenal for both Killers and Survivors. It allows them to see what the other is doing for tracking and avoiding, but a lot of perks have a distance limit, which is where open-handed comes in.

  • Dark Sense (General Perk): When a generator is completed, Dark Sense is activated, revealing the Killer's aura for 10 seconds if they come within 24 meters of the Survivor.
  • Open-Handed (Ace Visconti): Increases the radius of all Aura-reading abilities emanating from Survivors for up to 16 meters.
  • Babysitter (Steve Harrington): After unhooking another Survivor, the player sees the Killer's aura for 8 seconds. The Survivor who was unhooked doesn't leave blood pools or scratch marks and gains haste for up to 30 seconds.
  • Kindred (General Perk): Whenever the Killer is within 16 meters of a hooked Survivor, the Killer's aura is revealed to the player.

20 The Wiggle Build

Players Can Escape The Grasp Of The Killer With These Wiggle Perks

The wiggle build boosts Survivors' chances of escaping the Killer's clutches while being carried, making it great for Survivors who regularly risk Killer detection, wrath, and attention.

  • Boil Over (Kate Denson): Increases the swaying effects of wiggling on the Killer and obscures hook auras within a certain distance. When the Killer falls from a great height, it also accelerates the player's wiggle progression by 33%. Players can equip an Offering for one of the best maps for Survivors to maximize the perk's potential.
  • Flip Flop (Ash Williams): 50% of a player's recovery progression is transformed into wiggle progression.
  • Unbreakable (Bill Overbeck): This perk compliments Flip Flop by improving recovery speed, which is subsequently turned into wiggle progression.
  • Power Struggle (Élodie Rakoto): Carried Survivors can use a pallet to stun the Killer. It requires a 15% wiggle advancement to activate, which the perks listed above will assist in achieving.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Provides Exciting Info for Capitano Fans
item.description:
Summary

  • Fans are hopeful that Capitano may become a playable character based on leaks hinting at his potential inclusion.
  • Despite previous rumors of Capitano's future demise, leaks suggest he may survive and join the roster in future updates.

A new Genshin Impact leak has revealed interesting details about Capitano, one of the most important characters in the Natlan arc. So far, Capitano has been portrayed as the main antagonist in the current Genshin Impact storyline, and he has already made multiple in-game appearances.

Capitano belongs to the Fatui Harbingers, extremely powerful high-ranking officers who work for the Tsaritsa, known as the leader of the Fatui organization, as well as the Archon of Snezhnaya. Over the last couple of months, many leakers have hinted at Capitano's potential to join the playable roster in the future.

It's safe to say that, apart from the Archons, Harbingers are among the most popular characters in Genshin Impact . This is likely why the question of Capitano's playability is such a big topic among players, with many fans claiming that HoYoverse would be missing out by not adding him to the roster. Unfortunately for many, previous leaks have revealed that despite his popularity, Capitano might not appear on a banner anytime soon. However, a new post on the Genshin Impact Leaks subreddit has revealed that some upcoming updates contain Capitano-related files labeled "SkillObj," which are exclusive to playable characters.

Genshin Impact: Could Capitano Become a Playable Character in the Future?

This leak gives hope to many Capitano fans who had written him off as a playable unit since multiple leaks suggested that he might even die in one of the upcoming updates. This would not be the first time HoYoverse killed off a Harbinger; the famous La Signora was defeated by Genshin Impact 's Electro Archon Raiden Shogun. However, La Signora is still part of the game and is featured as a Weekly Boss.

So far, Genshin Impact has introduced three Harbingers to the roster: Tartaglia, Wanderer, and Arlecchino. Wanderer, previously known as Scaramouche, made his first appearance back in 2020, and HoYoverse introduced him as a playable character in late 2022. Fans suspect that Capitano might receive similar treatment, provided he survives through the entire Natlan arc.

At the moment, there is not a lot of official information about Capitano other than that he is the First of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers in Genshin Impact , which hints at his immense power. However, Capitano himself revealed that he is currently in a weakened state as the curse of immortality has taken a toll on his body. Despite being considered a villain, Capitano is known for his righteousness and honor, which have previously prevented him from achieving victory in important battles.
